sessions.name: The Ionic Package
sessions.description: Mobile devices and browsers are now advanced enough that developers can build native-quality mobile apps using open web technologies like HTML5, Javascript, and CSS. In this talk, we’ll provide background on why and how we created Ionic, the design decisions made as we integrated Ionic with Angular, and the performance considerations for mobile platforms that our team had to overcome. We’ll also review new and upcoming Ionic features, and talk about the hidden powers and benefits of combining mobile app development and Angular.
sessions.name: Recyclable Plastic
Push Notifications in Ionic
sessions.description: Mobile devices and browsers are now advanced enough that developers can build native-quality mobile apps using open web technologies like HTML5, Javascript, and CSS. In this talk, we’ll provide background on why and how we created Ionic, the design decisions made as we integrated Ionic with Angular, and the performance considerations for mobile platforms that our team had to overcome. We’ll also review new and upcoming Ionic features, and talk about the hidden powers and benefits of combining mobile app development and Angular.
sessions.name: Landfill truck

speakers.name: Water Bottle
speakers.title: plastic
speakers.instruction: Rinse the bottle if it did not contain water

speakers.name: Pizza Box
speakers.title: Cardboard
speakers.material: Wet-strength paperboard, cardboard coated in or combined with other materials like plastic or wax.
speakers.instruction: Just throw it the compost bin

speakers.name: Yogurt Container
speakers.title: plastic
speakers.material: Wet-strength paperboard, cardboard coated in or combined with other materials like plastic or wax.
speakers.instruction: Rinse it very well until all remains are removed

speakers.name: Clothes
speakers.title: Fabric
speakers.material: Clothes today are made from a wide range of different materials. Traditional materials such as cotton, linen and leather are still sourced from plants and animals. But most clothes are more likely to be made of materials and chemicals derived from fossil fuel-based crude oil.

speakers.name: Medical Syringe
speakers.title: Medical equipment
speakers.garbageType: Disposal of Sharps by Health Care Facilities
speakers.material: Syringes are typically made of glass, polymer (plastic) or stainless steel
speakers.instruction: Place the syringe in the container and firmly close the cover. Wash your hands as soon as possible

speakers.name: Food Can
speakers.title: Metal
speakers.material: Cans are made of three different materials: aluminum, tin-coated steel (tinplate) and electrolytic chromium coated steel (ECCS).
speakers.instruction: Wash the can thoroughly from all food remains

speakers.name: Paper Cup
speakers.title: Cup
speakers.material: The paper cups have a thin plastic lining inside to prevent the liquid contents from leaking. However, the lead is made of plastic
speakers.instruction: Wash the lead thoroughly and throw it in the recycle bin. Throw the cup into the garbage

speakers.name: Wine Bottle
speakers.title: Bottle
speakers.material: The glass wine bottle is made up of mainly silica dioxide(SiO2), soda(Na2O), and lime(CaO).
speakers.instruction: Rinse the bottle thoroughly before throwing in the recycle bin

speakers.name: Tea Bag
speakers.title: Food
speakers.material: Tea bags are commonly made of filter paper or food-grade plastic, or occasionally of silk cotton or silk

speakers.name: Battery
speakers.title: Chemicals
speakers.material: Batteries contain lithium (Li), cobalt (Co), and nickel (Ni) in the cathode, graphite in the anode, as well as aluminum and copper in other cell and pack components.
speakers.instruction: Bring them to one of our drop-off locations for recycling.
